Posts.Content: Thanks for replying Ronstar. I did suffer with some joint pain during chemo, but I finished that in early September and haven’t had any until now, but it could still be in my system. I think that you might have a point about exercise though, as I’ve hardly moved over the last few weeks, with Christmas, the cold weather and radiotherapy, which has made me very tired. I might look into Pilates to start off with something gentle, but will have a chat with my gp when I’m next there. I hope your creakyness subsides soon. Take care.
Posts.Title: Aching joints

Posts.Content: I Just wondered if anyone has any tips with coping with aching joints and discomfort. I started tamoxifen 19 December, the same day as I started radiotherapy. Due to the Christmas holidays, my radiotherapy is going to be over 4 weeks. I started Rads again yesterday and had terrible joint aches and pains in my arms and legs, so took myself off to bed at 5.30pm. I can only presume that the joint aches and pains were down to the tamoxifen. Does anybody else get this and what do you take to try to comat this please? Xx
Posts.Title: Aching joints

Posts.Content: Hi ladies. I start my Radiotherapy on Tuesday.I was told to use deodorant that doesn't contain metal. What does everyone else use please? Xx
Posts.Title: ☢☢☢ December Radiotherapy Club ☢☢☢

Posts.Content: Thanks Star67. I'll have a look in Boots tomorrow. I got some Aloe Vera gel from Holland and Baratt yesterday, so I will be all prepared for Tuesday. Good luck with you Radiotherapy when it starts in January and we can tick another treatment off our list. I stopped using sprays after my surgery, 8 weeks ago, but hadn't even realised that some of them still contain aluminium so will get shopping preparation. Many thanks for your help.
Posts.Title: ☢☢☢ December Radiotherapy Club ☢☢☢

Posts.Content: So sorry to hear this.  Big, big hugs xxx
Posts.Title: its back for the third time

Posts.Content: And good luck with rest of yours Liz xxx
Posts.Title: Planning CT scan for radiotherapy needs to be redone

Posts.Content: Hi Liz. I developed a lump just above my scar following a mastectomy. I had it checked by my Breast nuse and radiologist who assured me that it was scar tissue just above my rib. They told me to massage the area and it does seem to of gone down. I started radiotherapy on 19 December, with no delays and it is going well. Always best to mention it though to be on the safe side. Good luck.
Posts.Title: Planning CT scan for radiotherapy needs to be redone

Posts.Content: I had a mastectomy and lymph node clearance 7 weeks ago. I'm doing my exercises regularly and massaging my arm as I thought I had a bit of cording, but over the last week my arm has swollen up, particularly around my wrist and hand. Do you think this could be lymphodema or is it still the after affects of surgery. I'm worried I've been massaging too much?
Posts.Title: Swollen wrist

Posts.Content: Ah Thankyou For your advice. I slept with my arm raised up last night and my hand does look less puffy than yesterday. I still haven't heard anything about an appointment at the Lymphodema Clinic. I will keep trying to raise it up and hopefully it will continue to reduce and fingers crossed I will get an appointment through soon. Take care Mira and the rest of you lovely ladies. Many thanks
Posts.Title: Swollen wrist

Posts.Content: I will do. Thankyou Aliblue xxx
Posts.Title: Swollen wrist

Posts.Content: Thanks Suzanne. I will certainly ask about a compression sleeve and about reasonable adjustments when I go back to work. I’m an administrator at a university, so my whole work station will need to be assessed. I’m hoping that they can get this under control and hope that yours continues to do so also. Take care.
Posts.Title: Swollen wrist

Posts.Content: Hi everyone. I hope you've had a lovely Christmas. Just wanted to let you know that I managed to see the lymphodema nurse last week, who confirmed that's what it is. She also told me that I had an infection, so put me on antibiotics for 2 weeks. I have to go back and see her once the infection has gone and she will deal with it once that has cleared up, but good that I got in before Christmas xxx
Posts.Title: Swollen wrist

Posts.Content: Thanks Mira for your advice and kind words. I’m glad I pushed to be seen!! I was shown how to massage my arm which I’ve been doing, but stupidly slept in a bracelet the other night which made my wrist swell up more again, but with massage and elevation it has settled down a bit. (No more bracelets for me lol) I go back next week, but she can’t do any proper work on me until my Radiotherapy is finished on 11 January and hopefully I’ll get a compression sleeve. It sounds like you’ve got things under control, although it’s something you have to live with, which is a bummer on top of everything. Yes I do have a prosethis and 4 ameano bras, but I will certainly ask about a compression bra. I hope you enjoy the rest of the Christmas holidays. Big hugs back xxx
Posts.Title: Swollen wrist

Posts.Content: Aw Thanks ladies. I've rang my breast nurse and she is going to refer me to the Lymphodema clinic to be on the safe side, but in the mean time I will take your advice and elevate my arm and just do gentle strokes towards my heart. Many thanks
Posts.Title: Swollen wrist

Posts.Content: Thanks Mira. My hand is slightly more swollen today, but the breast nurse said my referral could be after Christmas. I'm going to keep elevating it, but will leave off the massage for now until I know exactly what I'm doing, although I will have a look a YouTube like you suggested. Much appreciated. Have you suffered with lymphodema yourself? Xx
Posts.Title: Swollen wrist

Posts.Content: Thanks Duftwolke. Sounds like you have almost every colour. The new fashion accessory hey lol. I will ask about getting fitted for a sleeve when I go back and get this arm under control. Take care and enjoy the holidays xxx
Posts.Title: Swollen wrist

Posts.Content: I was just wanting to asks everyone's opinion. I'm in the middle of radiotherapy, but requested a CT scan once this is all finished for peace of mind that everything's gone. An appointment now has come through for me to have a CT scan, bone scan and radiotherapy all on the same day. This is happening at two different hospitals so it might be that it hasn't been picked up, but I'm not sure it's advisable to have this amount of radiation pumped into me within 6 hours. Do you think this is wise? Xx
Posts.Title: Radiation Overlaod

Posts.Content: Thanks Suziedoll. I will check that it’s ok with the radiotherapists. I asked for another CT scan because I had chemo before surgery, which only had a partial response to my tumour and lymph nodes. During chemo I sometimes wondered if it was working, so these scans on the aftermath will hopefully give me peace of mind that it’s gone and then I will be able to get back to some normality.
Posts.Title: Radiation Overlaod

Posts.Content: Congratulations on completing your chemo. I finished mine 8 weeks ago. My eyelashes are starting to grow a little bit, but they did this a couple of weeks ago and fell out again, so I'm hoping these ones are going to stay lol!! My eyebrows are growing back now, although I never lost all of them, they just became sparse. I used the cold cap so I didn't lose all of my hair, although it's quite short as the length snapped off it. It is certainly thickening up and going curly. I can get it into a very tiny ponytail and use a Chinese chopstick to push through and fasten a hair scrunchy round it. My roots are dark and I can't wait to be able to have highlights again, but hopefully by Christmas I'll have enough hair to get it done. Good luck and I hope you have a speedy hair growth!! Xxx
Posts.Title: Last chemo & hair regrowth

Posts.Content: I'm just wondering if anyone else has paid privately for Brca1 and 2 Testing. The NHS won't pay for me to have it, as although both myself and mum have had Invasive Lobular Breast cancer I'm only classes as a moderate risk? I'm just wondering whether I should pay to be tested myself. They may offer me the CDH1 test as my grandad had Gastric cancer which is linked to Lobular, but haven't decided yet.  Thanks Hides xx
Posts.Title: Gentics Testing

Posts.Content: Thanks everyone for your suggestions. I'm going to have serious a look at all of them and decide from there!! During chemo I took Manuka honey which is good for immunity, which I think helped, plus drinking lots and lots of water. I must admit that on my third week, before chemo started again I did treat myself to the odd glass of wine and GnT. I was told that the odd one wouldn't do me any harm if I felt up to it and TBH it did me the world of good, so once your feeling a bit better, get one down you!! Bottoms up Xxx
Posts.Title: * * * SEPTEMBER BREAST CANCER CHEMO CLUB * * *

Posts.Content: Yes the FEC-T does have a cumlative effect, but more so on the t part (docetaxol) You will probably feel more lethargic, which I found after my 5th chemo, when usually after one week I was full of life, but then it did really floor me. But as long as you know that, you can prepare yourself for it. Good luck xxx
Posts.Title: * * * SEPTEMBER BREAST CANCER CHEMO CLUB * * *

Posts.Content: I read that some people's nails go black and fall off with Docetaxol, but I never experienced that. They were just very soft and snapped easily, so nail varnish will strengthen them. The skin peeled off the bottom of my feet, but I had hard skin, so it saved me a fortune on a pedicure lol!!  I'm not surprised your not sleeping happymum, you'll have so much going on in your mind.  Even now sometimes I get up during the night, after finishing chemo, as I've got surgery next, so that's going round in my mind. Good luck with fec. The waiting is really hard. Big hugs xxx
Posts.Title: * * * SEPTEMBER BREAST CANCER CHEMO CLUB * * *

Posts.Content: I'm just wondering if anybody can suggest a good shampoo to help my hair grow back. I finished chemo last Friday woohoo!! and although it hasn't been easy, I got through it. It's only been four days, so I'm still suffering the side effects, but I know there is light at the end of the tunnel.  I used the cold cap and have lost quite a bit of hair, with a bald patch at the back, but I'm so glad I used the cap as if I wrap a scrunchy hair piece around my tiny ponytail, nobody can tell, providing it doesn't fall out lol!! I was told it would start to grow back in about a month and I can dye it in three months, but any suggestions to get it moving would be great? Many thanks
Posts.Title: * * * SEPTEMBER BREAST CANCER CHEMO CLUB * * *

Posts.Content: Ps. I do love that song Roar. It's very appropriate!! Good luck everyone starting your chemo. I found it went quite fast and when I felt well I tried to treat myself and have fun with my friends and family. Just be kind to yourself and hopefully it will be done before you know it. Big hugs xxx
Posts.Title: * * * SEPTEMBER BREAST CANCER CHEMO CLUB * * *

Posts.Content: Hi everyone. I had a mastectomy and full lymph node clearance 2 weeks ago. The scar where my breast was removed isn't causing me too much discomfort, although I can feel lumps under my scar and wondered if anyone else had experienced this. The breast nurse seemed to think it was just fatty tissue and nothing to be concerned about. Also From my lymph nodes being removed I have no feeling under my armpit which I expected, but underneath my arm up to my elbow is pretty painful and uncomfortable. How long should I expect this to last for? Anyone else's experience in this would be greatly appreciated. Thanks Hides xxx
Posts.Title: Recovery after surgery

Posts.Content: Hi Toxophilite. Thankyou for replying.That was very helpful and something for me to focus on xxx
Posts.Title: Recovery after surgery

Posts.Content: Fantastic news xxx
Posts.Title: Phew!

Posts.Content: It does give my reassurance. Thanks Brook72 and I hope the soreness and uncomfortable feelings disappear for you soon too. Take care xxx
Posts.Title: Recovery after surgery

Posts.Content: Thanks Lynn I'll give the Chemo unit a ring in the morning to make sure it's vein damage and nothing more serious.  Cheers Hides xx
Posts.Title: *** July 2017 Chemo Club ***

Posts.Content: Sorry Teeshun, that's something that I haven't experienced, just lower back pain from the injections, although I know that chemo does tend to hit your weak spots, which might be the case. I would top up in the pain killers in that case.  I hope you feel better soon xx I was just wondering if any had experienced this: I had my 3rd chemo on Friday and since then I've had pain in my wrist on the same side that the cannula was inserted. It seems slighted swollen, especially if I have my watch on and it's sore when I bend my wrist forward. I never had this with my previous treatments and wondered if anybody knows what this could be please?  Thanks Hides xx
Posts.Title: *** July 2017 Chemo Club ***

Posts.Content: Aw Im so happy for you. Continue with your celebrating!! That's fantastic news. Sounds to  me they were certain it wasn't anything suspicious, so no need for biopsy. Take care.  Hides xxx
Posts.Title: Test day today!

Posts.Content: Good luck for today Emma. I went to the doctors thinking something felt different and was referred for a mammogram, ultrasound and once they looked closer at the lump and thought it was suspicious they did biopsies from my breast and under my arm pit, at the one stop shop so It was all done together on the same day.  They know what they're looking for and if they thinks it's suspicious they'll investigate further. Mine turned out to be Invasive Lobular Breast Cancer and was told on that day that it was highly likely, to be confirmed the following week. I really hope that it turns out to be benign, but if it isn't they'll do everything in their power to get rid of it and get you well. Big hugs xxx
Posts.Title: Test day today!
